data.title: Windows 10 Mobile needs 5 seconds more than Android to start - compiling shaders
data.body:
Issue:
Start any cocos2dx app on android: startup time 1s
Start the same app on Windows 10 Mobile: startup time 6 seconds

5 seconds in mobile world it is really to much ...

Issue exist for Windows 10 Mobile and Windows Phone 8.1.
It caused by compiling shaders from OpenGL to DirectX:
GLProgramCache::loadDefaultGLPrograms() 
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/renderer/CCGLProgramCache.cpp

Is it possible to fix it ? Maybe we can:
1. Use precompiled shaders for Windows 10 mobile
2. Optimize this process
2.1. Load only obligatory shaders on startup +
2.2. Load in separate thread +
2.3. Lazy initialization +

From private correspondence with dalestam@microsoft.com:
1. "The approx. 5s delay is compiling all of the cached cocos2d-x shaders. The shaders take longer to compile because the Windows 10 version has to use the ANGLE lib to convert the shaders from OpenGL to DirectX.
....
you can comment out some of the shaders being loaded by GLProgramCache::loadDefaultGLPrograms() starting at line 133. 
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/renderer/CCGLProgramCache.cpp
You will need to experiment to see which shaders are not needed by your game.
"
Regards,
CHP

data.title: Fix warnings caused by comparison between RefPtr and C++11's nullptr
data.body:
When using `RefPtr<T>` with GCC 5.2.1 on Ubuntu 15.10, I get the following warning messages:

```
cocos/base/CCRefPtr.h: In member function ‘bool cocos2d::RefPtr<T>::operator>(std::nullptr_t) const’:
cocos/base/CCRefPtr.h:215:79: warning: ordered comparison of pointer with integer zero [-Wextra]
     inline bool operator > (const std::nullptr_t other) const { return _ptr > other; }
                                                                               ^
cocos/base/CCRefPtr.h: In member function ‘bool cocos2d::RefPtr<T>::operator<(std::nullptr_t) const’:
cocos/base/CCRefPtr.h:224:79: warning: ordered comparison of pointer with integer zero [-Wextra]
     inline bool operator < (const std::nullptr_t other) const { return _ptr < other; }
                                                                               ^
cocos/base/CCRefPtr.h: In member function ‘bool cocos2d::RefPtr<T>::operator>=(std::nullptr_t) const’:
cocos/base/CCRefPtr.h:233:81: warning: ordered comparison of pointer with integer zero [-Wextra]
     inline bool operator >= (const std::nullptr_t other) const { return _ptr >= other; }
                                                                                 ^
cocos/base/CCRefPtr.h: In member function ‘bool cocos2d::RefPtr<T>::operator<=(std::nullptr_t) const’:
cocos/base/CCRefPtr.h:242:81: warning: ordered comparison of pointer with integer zero [-Wextra]
     inline bool operator <= (const std::nullptr_t other) const { return _ptr <= other; }
                                                                                 ^
```

This problem seems to be caused by ordered comparison between pointers and null pointer constant. So we can use `std::less()` instead of relational operators such as `<`, `>`, `<=` and `>=`. This pull request fixes them.

data.title: compiling error with ndk r11c
data.body:
Will cause compiling error with JSB projects, the error message is 

> /Users/minggo/SourceCode/cocos2d-x/tests/js-tests/project/proj.android/../../../../external/spidermonkey/prebuilt/android/armeabi/libjs_static.a(ExecutableAllocatorPosix.o):function JSC::ExecutableAllocator::determinePageSize(): error: undefined reference to '__page_size'

The reason is __page_size was replaced with PAGE_SIZE for Android API levels 12 and under since NDK r11+. The commit of NDK modification is: https://android.googlesource.com/platform/development/+/11ae5ebfb66727ba6f6d4e9a878ec0795e18993a%5E!/

data.title: GLViewImpl::create() should support full screen
data.body:
GLViewImpl::createWithRect() accept a parameter to determine support full screen or not. GLViewImpl::create() should do it like this.

I think it is better to add a new method:

``` c++
GLViewImpl::create(const std::string& viewName, bool fullscreen);
```

data.title: Crash on UIKeyboardNotification on glView on iOS platform
data.body: When cocos 2d-x is integrated on top of UIKit,that is,we have a few native iOS view controllers and then move into cocos 2d-x screen,the application works fine.Now,when we move back to iOS screen from the cocos 2d-x screen by invoking Director::getInstance()->end(),without exiting the application,we are able to transition back to iOS screen from cocos 2d-x screen without problems.Supposing there is a text field in the iOS screen and we tap on the text field after transitioning from the cocos 2d-x screen,the application crashes when the keyboard is to be shown up for the textfield in the iOS screen.This is because the UIKeyboardNotification which was set on the glView of the cocos 2d-x screen has not been removed when releasing the glView during Director::getInstance()->end() and the UIKeyboardNotification is still active and called on the released glView.On inspecting the code in CCEAGLView-ios.mm file,in the dealloc method,the UIKeyboardNotification is being removed and other cleanup of the glview is done.But when Director::getInstance()->end() is invoked it does not invoke the dealloc method of CCEAGLView at all.Hence the UIKeyboardNotification is still active even though the glView is released.Could the Director::getInstance()->end() functionality be improvised so that the dealloc method of CCEAGLView-ios.mm is invoked implicitly?
